A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the keyword, go, username or password parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1055.title: MediaWiki index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1055.body: MediaWiki is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the rs parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability on MediaWiki 1.8.3 - 1.9.2, the attacker would first be required to UTF-7 encode the URL, and browser encoding auto-detection must be enabled. Versions 1.8.2 and prior do not require encoding.Upgrade to the latest version of MediaWiki (1.9.3 or later), available from the MediaWiki Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1062.title: Cisco Unified IP Conference Station URL authentication bypass
CVE-2007-1062.body: Cisco Unified IP Conference Station models 7935 and 7936 could allow a remote attacker to bypass authentication caused by an error in releasing cached administrator credentials. By sending a URL request to the administrative HTTP interface, a remote attacker could bypass authentication and gain administrative access to the device.Refer to cisco-sa-20070221-phone for suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1076.title: phpTrafficA plotStat.php and banref.php file include
CVE-2007-1076.body: phpTrafficA could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the plotStat.php script using the file parameter or to the banref.php script using the lang parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.Upgrade to the latest version of phpTrafficA (1.4.2 or later), available from the phpTrafficA Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1082.title: FTP Explorer PWD command denial of service
CVE-2007-1082.body: FTP Explorer is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper handling of responses. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted response containing an overly long PWD command to consume all available CPU resources, resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of FTP Explorer (1.0.1.52 or later) from the FTP Explorer Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1083.title: VeriSign ConfigChk ActiveX Control buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1083.body: The VeriSign ConfigChk ActiveX Control (VSCnfChk.dll), which is used in multiple VeriSign products, is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the VerCompare() method. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page or open a specially-crafted HTML email that passes an overly long argument to the VerCompare() method, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Refer to US-CERT Vulnerability Note VU#308087 for upgrade and workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1087.title: IBM DB2 BSS segment buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1087.body: IBM DB2 is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by BSS segment buffers. By copying data from an environment variable, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with root privileges.Refer to IBM APAR IY94833 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1088.title: IBM DB2 environmental variable string buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1088.body: IBM DB2 is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of environment variable strings. By specifying an environment variable with an overly long string value, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with root privileges.Refer to IBM APAR IY94833 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1093.title: Hitachi JP1/Cm2 Network Node Manager unspecified denial of service
CVE-2007-1093.body: Hitachi JP1/Cm2 Network Node Manager is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an unspecified error. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service.Refer to HS07-002 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1093.title: Hitachi JP1/Cm2 Network Node Manager unspecified code execution
CVE-2007-1093.body: Hitachi JP1/Cm2 Network Node Manager could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an unspecified error. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.Refer to HS07-002 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1097.title: Wiclear onAttachFiles() function file upload
CVE-2007-1097.body: Wiclear could allow a remote attacker to upload arbitrary files, caused by improper validation by the onAttachFiles() function. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted request to upload a malicious script, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Wiclear (0.11.1 or later), available from the Wiclear Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1109.title: PhpWebGallery register.php and search.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1109.body: PhpWebGallery is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in the register.php script using the login or mail_address parameter or the search.php script using various parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1143.title: J-Web Pics Navigator dir parameter directory traversal
CVE-2007-1143.body: J-Web Pics Navigator could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the pn-menu.php or jwpn-photos.php script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the dir parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1144.title: J-Web Pics Navigator dir parameter directory traversal
CVE-2007-1144.body: J-Web Pics Navigator could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the pn-menu.php or jwpn-photos.php script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the dir parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1154.title: webSPELL login SQL injection
CVE-2007-1154.body: webSPELL is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements when logging in using the ws_auth cookie parameter, which could allow the attacker to bypass user authentication and possibly view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1155.title: webSPELL add squad feature file upload
CVE-2007-1155.body: webSPELL could allow a remote authenticated attacker to upload malicious PHP files. A remote authenticated attacker could send a specially-crafted request using the "add squad" feature to upload a malicious PHP file, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1157.title: JBoss jmx-console cross-site request forgery
CVE-2007-1157.body: JBoss is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the /jmx-console/HtmlAdaptor. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted POST request to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activity, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit a malicious site.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1164.title: DBImageGallery donsimg_base_path parameter file include
CVE-2007-1164.body: DBImageGallery could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the donsimg_base_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: The following scripts are reported to be vulnerable: admin/attributes.php admin/images.php admin/scan.php includes/attributes.php includes/db_utils.php includes/images.php includes/utils.php includes/values.phpUpgrade to the latest version of DBImageGallery (1.2.3 or later), available from the DBImageGallery Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1214.title: Microsoft Excel autofilter code execution
CVE-2007-1214.body: Microsoft Excel could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of an Excel file containing malformed autofilter that could cause memory corruption. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted Excel file, either by hosting the document on a Web site or sending it as an email attachment.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2007-1218.title: tcpdump print-802_11.c printer buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1218.body: tcpdump is vulnerable to an off-by-one buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the parse_elements() in print-802_11.c. By sending a specially-crafted 802.11 frame, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (print-802_11.c), available from the tcpdump CVS Repository. See References.For Ubuntu Linux (tcpdump):Refer to USN-429-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux (tcpdump):Refer to MDKSA-2007:056 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian Linux:Refer to DSA-1272-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Turbolinux (Tcpdump):Refer to TLSA-2007-46 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2007-1227.title: McAfee Virex Library file privilege escalation
CVE-2007-1227.body: McAfee Virex could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system. The Library/Application/Sypport/Virex/VShieldExecute.txt file was created with insecure permissions. A local authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a symbolic link from the /Library/Application Support/Virex/VShieldExclude.txt file to the /var/cron/tabs/root file to execute arbitrary commands on the system with ROOT privileges.Refer to McAfee ServicePortal Document ID: 518722 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1229.title: Nullsoft SHOUTcast administrative interface cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1229.body: Nullsoft SHOUTcast is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the administrative interface. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in an admin's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the log file is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1231.title: SQLiteManager main.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1231.body: SQLiteManager is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the main.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the database, ViewName, view, trigger, function and possibly other form fields to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1233.title: STWC-Counter downloadcounter.php file include
CVE-2007-1233.body: STWC-Counter could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the downloadcounter.php script using the stwc_counter_verzeichniss parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1240.title: Docebo CMS index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1240.body: Docebo CMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the searchkey, sn, or ri parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1247.title: aWebNews path_to_news parameter file include
CVE-2007-1247.body: aWebNews could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the listing.php or visview.php scripts using the path_to_news parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1248.title: Built2Go News Manager Blog news.php and rating.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1248.body: Built2Go News Manager Blog is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the news.php script using the cid, uid or the nid parameter and the rating.php script using the nid parameter. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Built2Go News Manager Blog (1.0.3 or later), available from the Built2Go Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1250.title: ANGEL Learning Management Suite (LMS) default.asp SQL injection
CVE-2007-1250.body: ANGEL Learning Management Suite is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the default.asp script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of ANGEL Learning Management Suite (LMS), available to registered users from the ANGEL Learning Management Suite Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1253.title: Blender .kml or .kmz file command execution
CVE-2007-1253.body: Blender could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper validation of user-supplied by the kmz_ImportWithMesh.py script. By persuading a user to import a specially-crafted .kml or .kmz file, a remote attacker could inject and execute arbitrary Python commands on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Blender (2.43 or later), available from the Blender Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to GLSA 200704-19 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-1257.title: Cisco Catalyst NAM SNMP packet spoofing unauthorized access
CVE-2007-1257.body: An unspecified vulnerability in Cisco Catalyst 6000, 6500, and 7600 series switches with the Network Analysis Module (NAM) installed could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by spoofing Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) packets from the NAM IP address to gain complete control of the vulnerable device.Refer to cisco-sa-20070228-nam for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1276.title: Webmin and Usermin chooser.cgi cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1276.body: Webmin and Usermin are vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the chooser.cgi script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a specially-crafted Web page containing a malicious filename which would execute JavaScript in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.For Webmin:Upgrade to the latest version of Webmin (1.330 or later), available from the Webmin Web site. See References.For Usermin:Upgrade to the latest version of Usermin (1.260 or later), available from the Usermin Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1277.title: WordPress theme.php command execution
CVE-2007-1277.body: WordPress could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the theme.php script. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted request to the theme.php script using the iz parameter to inject and execute malicious shell commands with the privileges of the Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of WordPress (2.1.2 or later), available from the WordPress Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1277.title: WordPress feed.php code execution
CVE-2007-1277.body: WordPress could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system caused by improper validation of input by the feed.php script. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted request using the ix parameter to execute arbitrary PHP code on the system with the privileges of the Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of WordPress (2.1.2 or later), available from the WordPress Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1308.title: Konqueror KDE JavaScript implementation KJS denial of service
CVE-2007-1308.body: Konqueror is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the KDE JavaScript implementation (KJS). A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a specially-crafted Web page containing an IFRAME tag with an ftp:// URL to cause a victim's browser to crash, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit the malicious Web page.For Mandriva Linux (kdelibs):Refer to MDKSA-2007:054 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux (kdelibs):Refer to USN-447-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-1327.title: SILC Server apps/silcd/command.c denial of service
CVE-2007-1327.body: SILC Server is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a NULL pointer dereference in the apps/silcd/command.c file. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating or joining a server channel with a specially-crafted hmac algorithm name and no cipher algorithm name to crash the server.Upgrade to the latest version of SILC Server (1.0.3 or later), available from the SILC Server Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200703-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1349.title: mod_perl path_info parameter denial of service
CVE-2007-1349.body: mod_perl is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper validation of the path_info parameter by a regular expression in the "RegistryCooker.pm" (mod_perl 2.x) and "PerlRun.pm" (mod_perl 1.x) functions. By sending requests to the vulnerable server using a specially-crafted URL, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service.Upgrade to the fixed version of mod_perl, available from the SVN Repository. CVE-2007-1351.title: X.Org X11 BDF font buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1351.body: X.Org X11 is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by an integer overflow vulnerability in the parsing of BDF fonts. By creating a specially-crafted BDF font file and persuading a victim to open the file, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with ROOT privileges or cause the system to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of X.Org X11 (7.2 or later), or apply the appropriate patch for your system, available from the X.Org Foundation Web site. CVE-2007-1413.title: PHP snmpget function buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1413.body: PHP is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the snmpget function. By sending a specially-crafted argument, an attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1415.title: PMB Services multiple scripts file include
CVE-2007-1415.body: PMB Services could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: The following scripts and parameters are affected by this vulnerability: includes/resa_func.inc.php using the class_path parameter includes/bull_info.inc.php using the include_path parameter includes/options/options_date_box.php using the include_path parameter includes/options/options_file_box.php using the include_path parameter includes/options/options_list.php using the include_path parameter includes/options/options_query_list.php using the include_path parameter includes/options/options_text.php using the include_path parameter includes/options_empr/options.php using the include_path parameter includes/options_empr/options_comment.php using the include_path parameter includes/options_empr/options_date_box.php using the include_path parameter includes/options_empr/options_list.php using the include_path parameter includes/options_empr/options_query_list.php using the include_path parameter includes/options_empr/options_text.php using the include_path parameter admin/import/iimport_expl.php using the include_path parameter admin/netbase/clean.php using the include_path parameter admin/notices/perso.inc.php using the class_path parameter admin/quotas/main.inc.php using the class_path parameter admin/param/param_func.inc.php using the include_path parameter admin/sauvegarde/lieux.inc.php using the include_path parameter opac_css/rec_panier.php using the base_path parameter opac_css/includes/author_see.inc.php using the base_path parameter autorites.php using the include_path parameter account.php using the include_path parameter cart.php using the include_path parameter edit.php using the include_path parameterUpgrade to the latest version of PMB (3.0.15 or later), available from the PMB Services Web site. CVE-2007-1468.title: IBM Rational ClearQuest defect tracking cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1468.body: IBM Rational ClearQuest is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the defect tracking form. An authenticated remote attacker with defect logging privileges could exploit this vulnerability using a text (.txt) file to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to IBM Rational ClearQuest Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1469.title: Absolute Image Gallery gallery.asp SQL injection
CVE-2007-1469.body: Absolute Image Gallery is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the gallery.asp script using the categoryid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1472.title: Groupit c_basepath parameter file include
CVE-2007-1472.body: Groupit could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the load.inc.php, userprofile.php, password.php, dispatch.php or deliver.php scripts using the c_basepath parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote or the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code using a local file, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1476.title: Symantec Norton Firewall SymTDI driver denial of service
CVE-2007-1476.body: Symantec Norton Firewall and Internet Security are vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the SymTDI driver. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted request to the input buffer to cause the system to crash.Refer to SYM07-024 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1478.title: McGallery download.php information disclosure
CVE-2007-1478.body: McGallery could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information caused by a vulnerability with the download.php script. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted request to the download.php script using the filename parameter to obtain arbitrary files on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1480.title: Creative Guestbook createadmin.php authentication bypass
CVE-2007-1480.body: Creative Guestbook could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a vulnerability in the authentication process in the createadmin.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass authentication and gain unauthorized administrative access to the application to manipulate data.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1482.title: WBBlog e_id parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1482.body: WBBlog is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using e_id parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1483.title: WebCalendar multiple scripts file include
CVE-2007-1483.body: WebCalendar could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the login.php, get_reminders.php, or get_events.php scripts using the includedir parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of WebCalendar (1.0.5 or later), available from the SourceForge Web site. CVE-2007-1548.title: Web Wiz Forums pop_up_member_search.asp SQL injection
CVE-2007-1548.body: Web Wiz Forums in the MySQL version is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the pop_up_member_search.asp script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Web Wiz Forums (8.05a or later), available from the Web Wiz Forums Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1562.title: Mozilla Firefox nsFtpState::R_pasv() information disclosure
CVE-2007-1562.body: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error in the nsFtpState::R_pasv function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a specially-crafted Web page on a malicious FTP server to bypass firewall security restrictions, scan ports, obtain sensitive information, and possibly cause the victim's browser to crash, if the attacker could persuade the victim to connect to the malicious FTP server. Note: KDE Konqueror and Opera are also affected by this vulnerability.Upgrade to the latest version of Mozilla Firefox (2.0.0.3 or 1.5.0.11 or later), as listed in MFSA 2007-11. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Firefox):Refer to RHSA-2007:0400 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-1579.title: Atrium MERCUR Messaging SUBSCRIBE command buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1579.body: Atrium MERCUR Messaging is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the IMAP service. By sending an overly long argument to the SUBSCRIBE command, a remote authenticated attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1580.title: Ftpdmin LIST command denial of service
CVE-2007-1580.body: Ftpdmin is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a buffer overflow that can occur when handling LIST commands. By sending an overly long LIST command, a remote authenticated attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the FTP service to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1581.title: PHP hash_update_file code execution
CVE-2007-1581.body: PHP could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on a system, caused by an error in the resource system's hash_update_file function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted PHP string containing a malicious userspace stream handler or error to delete and modify system resources and possibly execute arbitrary code on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1593.title: Symantec VERITAS Volume Replicator (VVR) denial of service
CVE-2007-1593.body: The Symantec Veritas Volume Replicator (VVR) is vulnerable to a denial of service. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted request to the administrative service to crash the service.Refer to SYM07-010 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1643.title: LMS userpanel.php and welcome.php file include
CVE-2007-1643.body: LMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the userpanel.php script using the CONFIG[directories][userpanel_dir] parameter or the welcome.php script using the _LIB_DIR parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of LMS (1.9.7 or later), available from the LMS Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1659.title: PCRE \Q\E regular expressions code execution
CVE-2007-1659.body: The PCRE (Perl Compatible Regular Expressions) library could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of "\Q\E" sequences containing orphaned "\E" codes. By passing specially-crafted data to an application linked to the vulnerable library, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the application.Upgrade to the latest version of PCRE (7.4 or later), available from the PCRE Web site. See References.For Mac OS X:Apply Security Update 2008-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2007-1660.title: PCRE unspecified character class denial of service
CVE-2007-1660.body: The PCRE (Perl Compatible Regular Expressions) library is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the processing of character classes that could result in improper memory allocation. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unspecified attack vectors to cause an application linked to the vulnerable library to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of PCRE (7.4 or later), available from the PCRE Web site. See References.For Mac OS X:Apply Security Update 2008-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2007-1673.title: Multiple vendor ZOO archive decompression denial of service
CVE-2007-1673.body: Barracuda Spam Firewall, Panda Software Antivirus, avast! antivirus, Avira AntiVir, zoo, unzoo, WinAce, PicoZip, AMaViS, and multiple unspecified applications that handle ZOO archives are vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the ZOO compression algorithm implementation. By sending a specially-crafted ZOO archive, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to consume all available system resources or crash the affected system.For Barracuda Spam Firewall:Upgrade to the latest virus definition version of Barracuda Spam Firewall (virusdef 2.0.6399 for 3.4 and after or virusdef 2.0.6399o for prior to 3.4), available from the automatic update.For Panda Software Antivirus:Upgrade to the latest version of Panda Software Antivirus (4/2/2007 or later), available from the automatic update feature.For avast! antivirus:Upgrade to the latest version of Panda Software Antivirus (4.7.981 or later), available from the avast! antivirus Web site. See references.For Avira AntiVir:Upgrade to the latest version of Avira AntiVir (avpack32.dll version 7.3.0.6 or later), available from the automatic update feature.For AMaViS:Refer to ASA-2007-2 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-1688.title: Callisto PhotoParade Player PhPinfo ActiveX control buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1688.body: Callisto PhotoParade Player is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the PhPinfo ActiveX control (PhPCtrl.dll). By persuading a victim to view a specially-crafted Web page or HTML email with a malicious FileVersionOf property, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the victim's privileges or cause the browser to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1709.title: phpDOC confirm_phpdoc_compiled buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1709.body: The phpDOC extension for PHP is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the confirm_phpdoc_compiled function. By sending a specially-crafted request, an authenticated remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1723.title: CipherTrust IronMail multiple method parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1723.body: CipherTrust IronMail is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by multiple scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the method parameter to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1735.title: Corel WordPerfect X3 printer selection (.PRS) filename buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1735.body: Corel WordPerfect X3 is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of the printer selection (.PRS) filename. By creating a specially-crafted WordPerfect document, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade the victim to open the malicious WordPerfect document.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1747.title: Microsoft Office drawing object code execution
CVE-2007-1747.body: Microsoft Office could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of a malformed drawing object that could cause memory corruption. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted Office document, either by hosting the document on a Web site or sending it as an email attachment.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2007-1748.title: Microsoft Windows DNS Server RPC interface buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1748.body: The Microsoft Windows Domain Name System (DNS) Server is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow in the RPC interface. By sending a specially-crafted Remote Procedure Call (RPC) packet to a vulnerable system, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with SYSTEM privileges.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS07-029. See References.

CVE-2007-1751.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer uninitialized object code execution
CVE-2007-1751.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a memory corruption vulnerability that occurs when Internet Explorer attempts to access objects that were not initialized or have been deleted. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2007-1773.title: aBitWhizzy whizzylink.php and whizzypic.php directory traversal
CVE-2007-1773.body: aBitWhizzy could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the whizzylink.php or whizzypic.php scripts containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the "d" parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1774.title: aBitWhizzy whizzylink.php and whizzypic.php scripts cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1774.body: aBitWhizzy is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the whizzylink.php or whizzypic.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the "d" parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1776.title: D4J eZine component for Joomla! index.php SQL injection
CVE-2007-1776.body: The D4J eZine component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the article parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1790.title: Kaqoo Auction install_root parameter file include
CVE-2007-1790.body: Kaqoo Auction could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the install_root parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Kaqoo Auction (2007033119 or later), available from the Kaqoo Auction Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-1793.title: Symantec Norton Personal Firewall SSDT denial of service
CVE-2007-1793.body: Symantec Norton Personal Firewall is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper permissions on the SPBBCDrv.sys driver's SSDT function handlers. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted NtCreateMutant or NtOpenEvent call to cause the system to crash. Note: Other products using the SPBBCDrv.sys driver may also be vulnerable.Refer to SYM08-022 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1797.title: ImageMagick ReadXWDImage() function buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1797.body: ImageMagick is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by multiple integer overflows in the ReadXWDImage() function related to the colors or comment field. By creating a malicious XWD image file and persuading a victim to open the file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Upgrade to the latest version of ImageMagick (6.3.3-5 or later), available from SourceForge.net Files. See References.For Gentoo Linux (ImageMagick):Refer to GLSA 200705-13 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-481-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux (ImageMagick):Refer to MDKSA-2007:147 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-1803.title: MailDwarf unspecified security bypass
CVE-2007-1803.body: MailDwarf could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and send large amounts of spam messages to arbitrary email addresses.Upgrade to the latest version of MailDwarf (3.10 or later), available from JVN#40511721. See References.

CVE-2007-1819.title: HP Mercury Quality Center ActiveX ProgColor buffer overflow
CVE-2007-1819.body: HP Mercury Quality Center is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow in the Spider90.ocx ActiveX control, caused by improper bounds checking of the ProgColor property. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page that sets the ProgColor property to an overly long value, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Refer to HPSBGN02199 SSRT071312 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-1843.title: MapLab params.php file include
CVE-2007-1843.body: MapLab could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the params.php script using the gszAppPath parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1859.title: XScreenSaver getpwuid() function authentication bypass
CVE-2007-1859.body: XScreenSaver could allow a local attacker to bypass authentication, caused by the improper parsing of a call to the getpwuid() function. If the application is using a remote directory service for login during a network outage, a local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to crash the application to unlock the screen and gain unauthorized access to the victim's system.Upgrade to the latest version of XScreenSaver (5.02 or later), available from the XScreenSaver Web site. See References.For Red Hat Linux (xscreensaver):Refer to RHSA-2007:0322-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (XScreenSaver):Refer to GLSA 200705-14 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux (xscreensaver):Refer to USN-474-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux (xscreensaver):Refer to MDKSA-2007:097 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-1860.title: Apache Tomcat JK Connector security bypass
CVE-2007-1860.body: The Apache Tomcat JK Connector could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a double-decoding error. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted URL to execute access control rules on the server.Upgrade to the latest version of Apache Tomcat JK Connector (1.2.23 or later), available from the Apache Tomcat Web site. See References.For Debian/GNU Linux:Refer to DSA-1312-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mac OS:Apply Apple Security Update 2007-007, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Apache mod_jk):Refer to GLSA 200708-15 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-1861.title: Linux kernel NETLINK_FIB_LOOKUP denial of service
CVE-2007-1861.body: Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an infinite recursion error in the nl_fib_lookup() function when handling NETLINK_FIB_LOOKUP reply messages. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a system panic or trigger a stack overflow.Upgrade to the latest stable version of the Linux kernel (2.6.20.8 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (linux-2.6):Refer to DSA-1289-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (kernel):Refer to RHSA-2007:0347 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux (linux-source):Refer to USN-489-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux (kernel):Refer to MDKSA-2007:171 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-1905.title: QuizShock auth.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-1905.body: QuizShock is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the auth.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the forward_to parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1920.title: SmodBIP index.php SQL injection
CVE-2007-1920.body: SmodBIP is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the zoom parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1949.title: webblizzard CMS PHPSESSID session hijacking
CVE-2007-1949.body: webblizzard CMS could allow a remote attacker to hijack a valid user's session, caused by a vulnerability in the cookie variable PHPSESSID. By setting the PHPSESSID variable to a fixed value, a remote attacker could hijack a victim's session once the victim logs in to the application using the set PHPSESSID value.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1951.title: oboShop PHPSESSID session hijacking
CVE-2007-1951.body: oboShop could allow a remote attacker to hijack a valid user's session, caused by a vulnerability in the cookie variable PHPSESSID. By setting the PHPSESSID variable to a fixed value, a remote attacker could hijack a victim's session once the victim logs in to the application using the set PHPSESSID value.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1952.title: onebyone CMS PHPSESSID session hijacking
CVE-2007-1952.body: onebyone CMS could allow a remote attacker to hijack a valid user's session, caused by a vulnerability in the cookie variable PHPSESSID. By setting the PHPSESSID variable to a fixed value, a remote attacker could hijack a victim's session once the victim logs in to the application using the set PHPSESSID value.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1953.title: courts online PHPSESSID session hijacking
CVE-2007-1953.body: courts online could allow a remote attacker to hijack a valid user's session, caused by a vulnerability in the cookie variable PHPSESSID. By setting the PHPSESSID variable to a fixed value, a remote attacker could hijack a victim's session once the victim logs in to the application using the set PHPSESSID value.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1962.title: XOOPS WF-Snippets module index.php SQL injection
CVE-2007-1962.body: The XOOPS WF-Snippets module is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the c parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-1993.title: HP-UX Portable File System (PFS) privilege escalation
CVE-2007-1993.body: HP-UX is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the Portable File System (PFS). By sending multiple specially-crafted UDP packets, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with root privileges.Refer to HPSBUX02203 SSRT071339 for suggested workaround information. See References.NOTE: As of March 1, 2004 the Portable File System (PFS) is no longer updated or supported on HP-UX platforms. HP now provides this functionality in the CDFS file system type combined with the HP-UX standard file system commands.

CVE-2007-1995.title: Quagga BGP attributes denial of service
CVE-2007-1995.body: Quagga is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper bounds checking of the BGP attributes by the bgpd daemon. By sending a specially-crafted UPDATE message, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause an assertion error, resulting in a denial of service.Refer to Quagga Bugzilla Bug 354 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to GLSA 200705-05 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (quagga):Refer to DSA-1293-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux (quagga):Refer to USN-461-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (quagga):Refer to RHSA-2007:0389 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris 10 x86 and SPARC:Refer to Sun Alert ID: 236141 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2007-2005.title: Taskhopper mosConfig_absolute_path file include
CVE-2007-2005.body: Taskhopper, component for Joomla and Mambo, could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the contact_type.php, itemstatus_type.php, projectstatus_type.php, request_type.php, responses_type.php, timelog_type.php, and urgency_type.php scripts using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2010.title: Bftpd GET and MGET commands denial of service
CVE-2007-2010.body: Bftpd is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a double-free memory corruption vulnerability when transferring files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted GET or MGET request to cause the daemon to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Bftpd (1.8 or later), available from the Bftpd Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-2022.title: Adobe Flash Player unspecified information disclosure
CVE-2007-2022.body: Adobe Macromedia Flash Player when used with Opera or Konqueror could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an unspecified vulnerability. By persuading a victim to view a specially-crafted Flash Player applet, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain browser keystrokes.Refer to APSB07-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Konqueror):Refer to RHSA-2007:0494-2 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux (kdebase):Refer to MDKSA-2007:138 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Turbo Linux (flash-player):Refer to TLSA-2007-36 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Flash Player):Refer to GLSA 200708-01 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2007-2029.title: Clam AntiVirus PDF handler denial of service
CVE-2007-2029.body: Clam AntiVirus (ClavAV) is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a file descriptor leak in the PDF handler. By sending a specially-crafted PDF file, a remote attacker could cause the system to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Clam AntiVirus (0.90.2 or later), available from SourceForge.net: Files. See References.For Debian Linux (clamav):Refer to DSA-1281-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux (clamav):Refer to MDKSA-2007:098 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-2037.title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Ethernet traffic denial of service
CVE-2007-2037.body: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) could allow a remote attacker on the local network segment to cause a denial of service. By sending malformed Ethernet traffic, a remote attacker could cause the controller to crash.Refer to cisco-sa-20070412-wlc for upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2007-2039.title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Network Processing Unit traffic denial of service
CVE-2007-2039.body: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) could allow a remote attacker on a local wireless network segment to cause a denial of service. By sending specially-crafted SNAP packets, 802.11 traffic, or packets containing values with unexpected lengths in certain headers, a remote attacker could cause the controller NPUs to lock. NOTE: Devices with WLC functionality provided by software are not affected by this vulnerability.Refer to cisco-sa-20070412-wlc for upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2007-2063.title: SSH Tectia Server PID and HFS privilege escalation
CVE-2007-2063.body: The SSH Tectia Server could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges caused by improper restriction on the PID and HFS files. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain elevated privileges.Upgrade to the latest version of SSH Tectia Server (5.4.0 or later), available from the SSH Tectia Server Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-2091.title: XOOPS TeamSpeak module tsdisplay4xoops_block2.php file include
CVE-2007-2091.body: XOOPS TeamSpeak module could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the tsdisplay4xoops_block2.php script using the xoops_url parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2138.title: PostgreSQL search_path privilege escalation
CVE-2007-2138.body: PostgreSQL could allow a local or remote attacker to gain elevated privileges caused by insecure search_path settings. An attacker could modify the search_path and use specially-crafted temporary objects to obtain privileges of SECURITY DEFINER functions.Refer to PostgreSQL News, 2007-04-23 for upgrade information. See References.For Mandriva Linux (postgresql):Refer to MDKSA-2007:094 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-454-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (postgresql):Refer to GLSA 200705-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Solaris:Refer to Sun Alert ID: 102894 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2007:0336 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (postgresql-8.1):Refer to DSA-1309-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian/GNU Linux:Refer to DSA-1311-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-2144.title: JoomlaPack component for Joomla! CAltInstaller.php file include
CVE-2007-2144.body: The JoomlaPack component for Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the CAltInstaller.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of JoomlaPack (1.1 or later), available from the JoomlaPack Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-2172.title: Linux kernel dn_fib_props and fib_props functions denial of service
CVE-2007-2172.body: Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an out-of-bounds error that can occur when the dn_fib_props and fib_props functions use the RTA_MAX as an array size instead of RTN_MAX. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of Linux kernel (2.6.21-rc6 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.For Ubuntu Linux (linux-source):Refer to USN-464-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (kernel):Refer to RHSA-2007:0347 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Avaya (kernel):Refer to ASA-2007-287 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (linux-2.6):Refer to DSA-1356-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux (kernel):Refer to MDKSA-2007:171 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (linux):Refer to DSA-1363-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-2199.title: phpSiteBackup pcltar.lib.php file include
CVE-2007-2199.body: phpSiteBackup could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the pcltar.lib.php script using the g_pcltar_lib_dir parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2199.title: cjgExplorerPro pcltar.lib.php and pcltrace.lib.php file include
CVE-2007-2199.body: cjgExplorerPro could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the pcltar.lib.php and pcltrace.lib.php scripts using the g_pcltar_lib_dir parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2199.title: Joomla! pcltar.php file include
CVE-2007-2199.body: Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the pcltar.php script using the g_pcltar_lib_dir parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2206.title: Ripe Website Manager index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-2206.body: Ripe Website Manager is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the ripeformpost parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Per private correspondence, the vendor states that this vulnerability has been fixed. Please contact the vendor for further information. See References.

CVE-2007-2217.title: Microsoft Windows Kodak image Viewer code execution
CVE-2007-2217.body: Microsoft Windows could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of images by the Windows Kodak image Viewer. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted image using the Kodak image Viewer, a remote attacker could corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending the malicious image as an email attachment or embedding the image within a document.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS07-055. See References.

CVE-2007-2230.title: Computer Associates (CA) CleverPath Portal search SQL injection
CVE-2007-2230.body: Computer Associates CleverPath Portal used in multiple CA products is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements using the search query, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to CleverPath Portal Security Notice for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-2238.title: Microsoft Intelligent Application Gateway Whale Client Components ActiveX control buffer overflow
CVE-2007-2238.body: The Microsoft Whale Intelligent Application Gateway Whale Client Components ActiveX control (WhlMgr.dll) is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page that passes overly long arguments to the CheckForUpdates() and UpdateComponents() method, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim or cause the victim's browser to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Microsoft Whale Communications Intelligent Application Gateway 2007 (SP2 or later), available from the Microsoft Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-2243.title: OpenSSH ChallengeResponseAuthentication information disclosure
CVE-2007-2243.body: OpenSSH could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper handling of error messages from failed login attempts. If ChallengeResponseAuthentication is enabled, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to enumerate system accounts and obtain sensitive information. Note: This vulnerability could also affect applications using OpenSSH.No remedy available as of December 2016.

CVE-2007-2244.title: Adobe Photoshop multiple files buffer overflow
CVE-2007-2244.body: Adobe Photoshop is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows. By creating a specially-crafted BMP, DIB or RLE file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade the victim to open the malicious file.Refer to APSB07-13, APSB07-16, and APSB07-17 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-2253.title: Exponent CMS multiple .php scripts path disclosure
CVE-2007-2253.body: Exponent CMS could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could send a direct request to the sdk/blanks/formcontrol.php or sdk/blanks/file_modules.php script using an invalid parameter to cause an error message to be returned containing the full installation path. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2263.title: RealNetworks RealPlayer SWF file buffer overflow
CVE-2007-2263.body: RealNetworks RealPlayer and RealOne Player are vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of SWF files. By persuading a victim to open a malformed SWF file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to the RealNetworks Customer Support - Real Security Updates Web page for upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2007-2264.title: RealNetworks RealPlayer RAM/RA file buffer overflow
CVE-2007-2264.body: RealNetworks RealPlayer and RealOne Player are vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of RAM and RA files. By persuading a victim to open a malformed RAM or RA file containing an overly long RA header, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to the RealNetworks Customer Support - Real Security Updates Web page for upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2007-2274.title: Opera BitTorrent denial of service
CVE-2007-2274.body: Opera is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by a vulnerability in the BitTorrent implementation within Opera. By persuading a victim to download a specially-crafted torrent file, a remote attacker could consume all available CPU resources or cause the victim's browser to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2277.title: Plogger PHPSESSID session hijacking
CVE-2007-2277.body: Plogger could allow a remote attacker to hijack a valid user's session. User-generated SIDs are accepted. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a specially-crafted Web page containing a malicious PHPSESSID value to hijack a victim's session and gain the victim's privileges, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit a malicious Web page and login to the affected application.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2279.title: Symantec Storage Foundation Scheduler Service security bypass
CVE-2007-2279.body: Symantec Storage Foundation could allow an authenticated remote attacker from within the local network to bypass security restrictions and possibly execute arbitrary code, caused by an error in the Scheduler Service. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass the built-in authentication in the management console and possibly manipulate the registry with arbitrary commands, which could be executed during regularly scheduled runs.Refer to SYM07-009 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-2292.title: Mozilla Firefox and SeaMonkey Digest Authentication LF response splitting
CVE-2007-2292.body: Mozilla Firefox and SeaMonkey are vulnerable to HTTP response splitting attacks, caused by improper validation of input passed to the Digest Authentication service. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted URL containing an encoded LF value in the username attribute to cause the server to return a split response, once the URL is clicked. This would allow the attacker to perform further attacks, such as Web cache poisoning, cross-site scripting, and possibly obtaining sensitive information.Refer to MFSA 2007-31 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Netscape:Upgrade to the latest version of Netscape (9.0.0.1 or later), available from the Netscape Web site. See References.For Warpzilla Enhanced Gecko:Upgrade to the latest version of Gecko (1.8.1.8 or later), available from SourceForge.net: Files. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2007-2295.title: Apple QuickTime H.264 code execution
CVE-2007-2295.body: Apple QuickTime could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an unspecified memory corruption vulnerability. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted H.264 movie file, a remote attacker could corrupt memory and cause the victim's QuickTime application to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the victim's system with the privileges of the user. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending the malicious file as an email attachment or hosting it on a Web site.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple QuickTime (7.2 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-2319.title: AutoStand Category mod_as_category.php file include
CVE-2007-2319.body: AutoStand Category module for Joomla could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the mod_as_category.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2322.title: Nero MediaHome CRLF sequences denial of service
CVE-2007-2322.body: Nero MediaHome is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a NULL pointer dereference in the NMMediaServer.exe. By sending a specially-crafted packet containing two CRLF sequences, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to crash the application.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2337.title: Exponent CMS multiple scripts cross-site scripting
CVE-2007-2337.body: Exponent CMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the weblogmodule module and the magpie_debug.php, magpie_simple.php, amd magpie_slashbox.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using various parameters to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2340.title: phpOracleView include_all.inc.php file include
CVE-2007-2340.body: phpOracleView could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the include_all.inc.php script using the page_dir parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2353.title: Apache Axis WSDL file path disclosure
CVE-2007-2353.body: Apache Axis could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request for a non-existent WSDL file to cause an error message to be returned containing the full installation path. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2007-2356.title: GIMP SUNRAS plugin buffer overflow
CVE-2007-2356.body: GIMP is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the set_color_table in the SUNRAS plugin. By creating a specially-crafted .RAS file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade the victim to open the malicious file.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to GLSA 200705-08 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux (gimp):Refer to USN-467-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2007:0343 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux (gimp):Refer to MDKSA-2007:108 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Turbolinux (gimp):Refer to TLSA-2007-34 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2007-2365.title: Multiple Adobe products .PNG file buffer overflow
CVE-2007-2365.body: Multiple Adobe products including Photoshop CS2/CS3, Photoshop Elements and Corel Paint Shop Pro are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the PNG.8BI Photoshop Format Plugin. By creating a specially-crafted .PNG file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade the victim to open the malicious file.Refer to APSB07-13, APSB07-16, and APSB07-17 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-2391.title: Apple Safari setTimeout cross-domain security bypass
CVE-2007-2391.body: Apple Safari could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page containing a windows.setTimeout JavaScript function, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof Web content or conduct phishing attacks.Apply APPLE-SA-2007-06-14, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-2401.title: Apple Mac OS X XMLHttpRequest HTTP header injection
CVE-2007-2401.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to header injection, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by headers passed to the XMLHttpRequest. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject arbitrary HTTP requests, which will allow the attacker to conduct various attacks against the vulnerable system, including cross-site scripting, cache poisoning or session hijacking.Apply Apple Security Update 2007-006, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For iPhone:Refer to APPLE Article ID: 306173 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2007-2402.title: Apple QuickTime Java applet information disclosure
CVE-2007-2402.body: Apple QuickTime could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a design error in the QuickTime for Java. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to capture the user's screen content and obtain sensitive information.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple QuickTime (7.2 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-2408.title: Apple Safari Java applet security bypass
CVE-2007-2408.body: Apple Safari could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a vulnerability within the handling of the "Enable Java" preference. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to load and run the applet, even when Java is disabled.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple Safari (3.0.3 beta or later), available from the Apple Safari Web site. See References.For Mac OS:Apply Apple Security Update 2007-007, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2007-2415.title: Pi3Web HTTP Server HTTP request denial of service
CVE-2007-2415.body: Pi3Web HTTP Server is vulnerable to a denial of service when handling HTTP requests. By sending an overly long specially-crafted HTTP request composed of multiple "\A" characters, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of Pi3Web (PL2 or later), available from the Pi3 Web page. See References.

CVE-2007-2418.title: Trillian Pro Rendezvous XMPP HTML buffer overflow
CVE-2007-2418.body: Trillian Pro is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the Rendezvous / Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP) module when decoding HTML. By sending a specially-crafted message, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Trillian (3.1.5.1 or later), available from the Trillian Web site. See References.

CVE-2007-2428.title: Ahhp-Portal page.php file include
CVE-2007-2428.body: Ahhp-Portal could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the page.php script using the fp or the sc parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.
